storyInfo: Honeyberry returns home to deal with a conflict between the village and the Infected, but the real problem is not with the Infected.

attributes.content: Really? Oripathy doesn't pass from the Infected to healthy people?
attributes.name: Campbell

attributes.content: Regular contact with Oripathy patients in stable conditions does not transmit Oripathy.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: But how do I know if someone is infected or not?
attributes.name: Campbell

attributes.content: I've contacted the nearest Rhodes Island office. They'll be sending test kits soonâ€”
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Just go home, kid, and tell your family to move as soon as you can.
attributes.name: Campbell

attributes.content: People are afraid that your dad will pass Oripathy onto other people. We can't afford that.
attributes.name: Campbell

attributes.content: Please, Mrs. Samantha, patients who are in stable conditions are not infectious.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: How can you prove that?
attributes.name: Samantha

attributes.content: I come from Rhodes Island, where the Infected and non-Infected live together. Infection is not a problem, as long as the progress of Oripathy is monitored regularly.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Don't play with that girl, Molly! They've got an Infected at home! You'll get the stone disease!
attributes.name: Samantha

attributes.content: Stone disease?
attributes.name: Samantha

attributes.content: A disease where you grow rocks from your body! It hurts so much you die from the pain alone!
attributes.name: Samantha

attributes.content: Water, Honeyberry?
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: Thanks.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: You spent all morning talking. Did they listen?
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: They will. As long as they can let go of their prejudice, there won't be any issues with the Infected here. And I won't need to be here.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: You're so patient with them.
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: If my own family was chased out, there's no way I'd set aside the grudge and come back to help them with their Infected problem, no matter how many years had passed.
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: It's... not that I've set it aside.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: The issue with Dad, I can understand. Hard not to panic when there's an Infected so close to you.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: But the thing with Mum, I could never...
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: I came because I want them to set their prejudices aside. I don't want another tragedy like mine to happen.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: No!
attributes.name: Martenson

attributes.content: My son's going to be a mining company manager! I can't have him living with the Infected!
attributes.name: Martenson

attributes.content: My son's joining the mining company! I can't have him live and eat with you people!
attributes.name: Martenson

attributes.content: Scram! Get out, while we're still asking nicely!
attributes.name: Martenson

attributes.content: We asked you to solve our Infected problem, not to preach at us!
attributes.name: Martenson

attributes.content: We're an important supply point for the mining company! How are we supposed to do business with those Infected making a mess every few days?
attributes.name: Martenson

attributes.content: I understand, I do.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: But think of it this way: the Infected won't do that if everyone's getting along, right?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Says you! Their ringleader only came back to cause trouble because he realized he could use Originium Arts. He's a lunatic with rocks growing out of his brain!
attributes.name: Martenson

attributes.content: Why youâ€”
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: We should go, Honeyberry.
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: Right... okay.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Looks like two-fifths are willing to listen, two-fifths are undecided, and the last fifth is strongly opposed.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: So what's our next move?
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: I think it's worth getting everyone together to talk this out.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: To be honest, the people you've categorized as 'willing to listen' seem pretty undecided to me.
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: Maybe you could reveal your identity? None of them recognized you. Maybe they'll be willing to side with you for old times' sake? Or even out of guilt.
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: I... don't want to do that.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Sorry.
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: But if the villagers really are as stubborn as you say...
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Anyway, let's get them together.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: ...The Infected and non-Infected can live together as long as there are proper identification, testing, and protection procedures in place.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Wait, it's you!
attributes.name: Martenson

attributes.content: What are you doing here? Get out! You're not welcome here!
attributes.name: Martenson

attributes.content: This is my home too. Who do you think you are?
attributes.name: Fierce Infected

attributes.content: So what's this all about? Some kinda meeting? Trying to run more Infected out of town? Hey, who the heck are you?
attributes.name: Fierce Infected

attributes.content: I'm Operator Honeyberry, from Rhodes Islandâ€”
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Rhodes Island? What's that? Did the mining company send you?
attributes.name: Fierce Infected

attributes.content: We did come at the mining company's request, but we're not taking a side here. We just want to get the problem resolved.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Yeah right! You're just the company's hounds!
attributes.name: Fierce Infected

attributes.content: You're coming with me! Let's see what you're plotting!
attributes.name: Fierce Infected

attributes.content: Sandwheel tries to get to Honeyberry, but she waves him off.
Suits me just fine. I was going to visit you anyway.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Ha, got a big mouth on you.
attributes.name: Fierce Infected

attributes.content: Gus, she's a guest. Show some respectâ€”
attributes.name: Samantha

attributes.content: Eek!
attributes.name: Samantha

attributes.content: Who's the one who needs to show respect here, huh?
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: Anyone who dares stand in my way gets it to the head!
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: We're here.
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: (This is...)
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Now spill it! Why'd they send you?!
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: What's the matter? You seemed pretty chatty back in the village.
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: How did you find this place?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: We had nowhere to go, and no one was living here. Why wouldn't we?
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: The first Infected from the village used to live here with his wife and kid.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Don't you try to change the subject with old stories or whatever.
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: I was telling the truth back there. I came to help solve your problems, Gus.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Solve my problems? How? I told them the rocks appeared on their own without catching it from anyone, but did they believe me?
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: That's why I'm promoting knowledge about proper Oripathy prevention and treatment, so that you can go back to the village.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Two figures emerge from the shadows.
Is that for real?
attributes.name: Infected A

attributes.content: We can go back to the village?
attributes.name: Infected B

attributes.content: Quiet! Stay outta this!
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: But she saidâ€”
attributes.name: Infected A

attributes.content: How do you know she's not lying?
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: I was telling the truth.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: And where's your sister, Gus?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: H-How did you know I had a sister?
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: Argh, whatever.
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: Lydia's in her room.
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: Hello, Lydia. Are you there?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Who's that? Another exile from the village? How is Carl?
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: I'm Operator Honeyberry, from Rhodes Island. I'm here to help.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Hello, Honeyberryâ€”
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: Wait, noâ€” *cough* You'reâ€”
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: Is it really you?! Zoey Perris?!
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: Lydia... you...
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Yes, we used to play together all the time. Even if the rest of the village forgot about me, you never...
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Of course I'd never forget my best mate... *cough*, *cough*
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: What about Mr. and Mrs. Perris? Did they go to Rhodes Island with you?
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: Mum's living with me on Rhodes Island. Dad passed away soon after he was chased out.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: ...I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: It's okay. I still remember how you used to bring us stuff after we were exiled.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: But after Grandpa found out...
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: Let's talk about you first. You don't look too good...
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: I've been feeling ill ever since I was exiled. Colds, headaches, occasional vomiting...
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: (Could Lydia be like Mum...?)
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Let me do a quick checkup.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: The quick test strips show an extremely low chance that you have Oripathy. I didn't see signs of any organic diseases either.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: No Originium crystals on the body surface... I'll check with more precise equipment.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: The results show you don't have Oripathy.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: I see...
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: (She doesn't seem happy about it...)
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Can I ask you something? Have you felt stressed lately?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Are you sure?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: There's just someone in the village I'm concerned about...
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: (Someone in the village? Is it the name she said before she recognized me?)
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Carl? Mr. Martenson's son?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Her childhood friend looks at her with a shocked expression, then tears begin flowing from her eyes.
Carl and I were going to tell Mr. Martenson about our relationship and get engaged. And then Gus got sick.
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: Carl and I had been looking forward to it and preparing for so long... and then...
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: Lydia...
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: I might never see him again. When I think about that, I...
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: Ughâ€”
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: Zoey, I'm feeling sick... I think I might throw up. Stay away...
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: Why would you say that?!
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Gus, Gus! Are you there?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: What's going on?
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: See if there's a kind of grass in the garden that's about the height of a human palm, with slightly red-tipped leaves growing in opposing pairs!
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Let me see... yeah. What about it?
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: Grab a few of them! Lydia's about to throw up, and that's a herb that can help.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: What? I'll get right on it!
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: How do you feel?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Zoey... much better. Thank you.
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: This is just for emergencies, though.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Whether it's some kind of organic disease I've never heard of, or the result of psychological factors, the herb will only alleviate the symptoms, not the cause.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: My mum was in a situation just like yours. She got much better after the psychological problems went away.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: And how'd she do that?
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: I grew up and reduced the burden on her. She didn't have to worry about tomorrow's bread, and our situation got better as well, so she got better on her own.
attributes.name: Honeyberry
Lydia
attributes.content: But how can I not worry?

attributes.name: Lydia
attributes.content: *cough,* *cough!*
The villagers see me as the family of an Infected. Gus is afraid they'll hurt me, and I... I'm like this.
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: I don't care if I'm infected, and I don't care what they think. All I want is to see Carl again... one more time...
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: I have an idea.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: I know of a herb that grows around here that can give you a fever, without seriously threatening your health.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: What's going on? Why does Lydia have a fever?!
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: The reason isn't important right now. What's important is that Lydia wants to go back to the village.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: I know that! How many times do you think she's told me?! It's always Carl this, Carl that! He's such a fraud!
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: He's not even showing his face at a time like this! That tells me all I need to know.
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: Lydia's feelings are real, though. Otherwise she wouldn't be so ill.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: No matter how much you hate Carl and the villagers, think of your sister. It's not Oripathy she has, it's an illness of the mind!
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: The mind...
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: If you're really worried about her, let her go back. I can guarantee that the villagers won't harm her.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: So... what? She sees that fraud and gets better. What then?
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: The village will never accept her, and it's not like Carl would ever come live with us. She'll still suffer in the end!
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: So you're just going to watch her suffer from the fever she's got right now?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Perris, the whole village will be destroyed if your Oripathy spreads.
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: But my wife and daughter are healthy! They don't have any stones on them!
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Better safe than sorry. It's all for the village, you know.
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: Gus, I came here to dispel the village's fear, and the prejudices you have of each other.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Sure, some rejected me, but others were willing to listen.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Just try it. For yourself, for Lydia, and for them.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: I can see you mean what you're saying, but I still don't believe those bastards can actually let go of their prejudices.
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: You mean...
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: You can try, but on one condition.
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: Most of the villagers don't know about Lydia and Carl. Martenson is only thinking about his son's career, and he sure as hell wasn't gonna go around and tell people about it.
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: You're not allowed to bring up Carl's name in the village. I want to see him step up on his own.
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: Otherwise, he'd only do it because he didn't have a choice.
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: Honeyberry, you're backâ€”wait, why did you bringâ€”
attributes.name: Campbell

attributes.content: Don't worry, Mrs. Campbell. Infected in stable condition are not contagious.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Lydia is living proof. She's been staying with the Infected for so long, but she never caught Oripathy.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Really? But why does she look so sickly then?
attributes.name: Campbell

attributes.content: Ah... that's why we came back. Let's just say that she's lovesick.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Lovesick? Now this I need to hear.
attributes.name: Campbell

attributes.content: Aha. So that's what this is about.
attributes.name: Campbell

attributes.content: Now why the heck didn't you let your sister come back and see her boyfriend, Gus?
attributes.name: Campbell

attributes.content: It was you people whoâ€”
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: Gus had his own troubles to deal with, ma'am. No one knew where the Oripathy came from, did they?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: So, who's the lucky young man who caught Lydia's eye?
attributes.name: Campbell

attributes.content: Sorry, I've got a non-disclosure agreement with Gus.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: How could you do that, Gus?
attributes.name: Campbell

attributes.content: Don't blame him. It's natural for him to be a little resentful after his exile from the village.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Besides, there's no real point if the young man isn't willing to step forward of his own accord, is there?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: You've got me there. Alright, I'll get everyone.
attributes.name: Campbell

attributes.content: (Whisper) Is Carl here, Lydia? I don't remember how he looks.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Still with a fever, Lydia bites her lip while casting her gaze towards a young man in a corner.
He stands beside Martenson, looking slightly timid. His father's eyes are wary as they meet Honeyberry's.
...Step forward, if you still love her.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: The crowd whispers amongst themselves. Some parents ask their children, while others ask Martenson, who shakes his head furiously.
Carl stands behind his father, his expression hidden from view.
The sickness of your beloved isn't because of Oripathy. It's because she misses you.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: She insisted on coming back to see you. Please, step forward!
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Martenson starts getting impatient and turns to leave, while Carl seems to be nailed to the ground.
Oripathy has fried the girl's brain. Get her out of here!
attributes.name: Martenson

attributes.content: Honeyberry thought she would hear objections from the crowd, but there were none.
Guys...
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: What are you afraid of?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Don't bother, Honeyberry. They won't listen.
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: No! I have to speak up!
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: The kids all love Mrs. Campbell because she always makes biscuits for them.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Mrs. Samantha doesn't trust people easily, but when she does, she always stands up for them.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: The Martenson family works hard to live a better life, without forgetting to help out their neighbors.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: This village is full of good people. What kind of deep, heavyâ€”evil fear could make you all so heartless and cruel?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: ...That's enough, Zoey.
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: Lydia?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: But you haven't seen your boyfriend yet.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: (Smiles meekly)
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: I saw him. I did.
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: He heard you scold everyone, and he stayed here in opposition to his family's wishes... The important thing is that I saw him, and he saw me.
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: I know he loves me. He just can't... I don't blame him. How can I?
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: It's enough, Zoey. I'm happy enough.
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: I don't want to make his life difficult, even if I'm not Infected.
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: We...
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: Weâ€”
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: (Sobs)
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: Let's go...
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: Carl?! Are you out of your mind? Where are you going?
attributes.name: Martenson

attributes.content: Carl hugs the weakened Lydia in his arms.
I swear I won't ever leave you again, Lydia.
attributes.name: Carl

attributes.content: Am... am I dreaming, Carl? It's a dream, right?
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: No, it's not a dream!
attributes.name: Carl

attributes.content: I almost lost you once. No one will ever keep us apart again!
attributes.name: Carl

attributes.content: (Rubs eyes)
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: You see, Gus? Just like I said.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Carl...
attributes.name: Gus

attributes.content: Honeyberry casts her gaze at the crowd and feels her heart sink.
Campbell is wiping tears from her eyes, but not many others are rejoicing for the young lovers.
More prevalent are expressions of hesitation, doubt, and fear.
Excuse me...
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Honeyberry feels a chill run down her back at the cold reaction of the crowd.
Will you accept Lydia back into the village?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: She said 'Lydia' rather than 'the Infected,' without even realizing it.
A moment of silence passes.
Finally, someone opens his mouth.
Think about it carefully, Carl.
attributes.name: Martenson

attributes.content: Go with her, and you can never come back.
attributes.name: Martenson

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: It can't be helped.
attributes.name: Martenson

attributes.content: Honeyberry feels a daze come over her.
Wh-What are you talking about? So many years have passed. Haven't we proven ourselves healthy by now?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: People are afraid, Zoey.
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: What are they afraid of?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: They forced dad out! He's not around anymore! Mum and I have lived in the forest for so many years! What makes them so afraid that we can't even set foot in the village?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: It can't be helped.
attributes.name: Lydia

attributes.content: It can't be helped? Is that your final answer?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Better safe than sorry, after all.
attributes.name: Samantha

attributes.content: How about this: I won't try to get Gus to pay for all the stuff he broke and all the lost business. We'll just leave each other alone going forward.
attributes.name: Samantha

attributes.content: That way, he won't come and cause any more trouble, right?
attributes.name: Samantha

attributes.content: Just have them go back. Once they're gone, the village will owe you a feast. Everyone appreciates how you took care of the problem.
attributes.name: Samantha

attributes.content: But I've already said that Oripathy patients in stable condition aren'tâ€”
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Just let it go, okay? Who knows who's Infected or not when they're not growing any rocks?
attributes.name: Samantha

attributes.content: Rhodes Island is sending over equipment for Oripathy screening and testing, and our staff will be teaching people how to use it. Isn't that enough to dispel your fear?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: That... that's in the future. What if there's a delay? What if there's an equipment error?
attributes.name: Samantha

attributes.content: Just let it go, and let them go. I'll make you my specialâ€”
attributes.name: Samantha

attributes.content: Mille-feuille.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Mrs. Samantha, I...
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: I'm Zoey Perris.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: A commotion spreads through the crowd.
Perris... You're Perris's girl, Zoey? You're not Infected?
attributes.name: Samantha

attributes.content: Like I said, Oripathy is not transmissible the way the flu is. Plus, Dadâ€”
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Get out! The children of the Infected are not welcome here!
attributes.name: Martenson

attributes.content: What are you talking about, Martenson?
attributes.name: Campbell

attributes.content: Perris was the first Infected in the village! How could we let his daughter in here?
attributes.name: Martenson

attributes.content: Didn't she just say that Oripathy isn't transmitted like that?
attributes.name: Campbell

attributes.content: Can she say for sure? Is she the one who'll have to pay the price if we have new Infected?
attributes.name: Martenson

attributes.content: Yeah, yeah!
attributes.name: Frightened Crowd

attributes.content: Iâ€”
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Honeyberry feels a lump in her throat and could say no more.
Martenson's attitude is harsh and stern, but Honeyberry sees only fear in his eyes.
The same fear that they had cast towards her family.
She looks around at Samantha, at the others, and sees the same in their eyes.
Honeyberry.
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: ...Sandwheel?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Don't forget what we're here for.
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: We're not here to promote proper Oripathy prevention and treatment, nor are we here to dispel their prejudices.
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: We're just here to resolve the Infected problem.
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: You've done what you could. Leave the rest to the operators delivering the equipment.
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: Our job now is to worry about Gus's group, and that pair of lovers.
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: Feeling better?
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: (Blows nose)
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Think about happier things.
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: Happier things?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Like about how Rhodes Island is opening an office in the nearest Rim Billiton nomadic city, and how they'll need new staff to run it.
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: ...Yes, we're lucky that Gus and the other two Infected have somewhere to go.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Lydia is recovering quickly, and she and Carl are applying to a mining company branch in the city. Isn't that something to be happy about?
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: Yeah...
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Now I'm realizing that the village never changed.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Not once, from the day they ran out our family, to the day Dad passed away, to the day I came to Rhodes Island with Mum, and all the way till today.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Most villages that small never change. That one just happens to lie on the supply route for a new Originium mine.
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: But this event... could it be the catalyst for change in the future?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Mind if I said something that you might not like to hear?
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: Go ahead.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Change was inevitable the moment ore deposits were found in the area.
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: The village has to either change, or perish.
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: You were still willing to come back and help them. That alone ought to push them to set aside old prejudices and fears.
attributes.name: Sandwheel

attributes.content: I'm jumping, Mint!
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Alright, I'm down here for youâ€”
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Phew.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: I was really worried when you came back from that field mission looking like a different person.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Just had a little bit of a shock. Got over it real quick, though.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: By the way, there was a letter for you yesterday. The Messenger left it with me when they couldn't find you.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: From where?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Rim Billiton. Here.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: I'm off for training. Feel free to join me after you read it.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Sure!
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Dear Zoey,
How are you doing?
Carl and I both applied to the mining company. Guess who got hired?
Both of us! I couldn't believe it!
We celebrated by having a nice meal out. Carl chose a Siracusan restaurant, and it was really good. We'll take you there next time you're here.
We both went through the entrance physical, and showed no trace of Oripathy. I've fully recovered from my symptoms too.
Thank you so much for your help.
Give your mum my regards!
Your dearest Lydia
P.S.: Carl's dad came to see him and brought him some food from home.
He said that the arguments went on for days after the Rhodes Island operators brought the Oripathy screening equipment and trained people how to use it.
In the end, they're letting the Infected and their families live near the village. They don't have to stay in the forest anymore.
He asked whether we wanted to go back, but Carl turned him down.
Even if Carl said yes, though, I wouldn't go back. I won't ever go back.
I guess I don't have to go back anymore.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: They've taken the first step. They'll put their prejudices aside.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: They will.
attributes.name: Honeyberry
